paragraph_text: Our mission is to promote a
sustainable environment
, which is reflected in the waste water treatment products we sell, purchase and use.
Australian Made
We are proud that the production and manufacturing of our waste water treatment products is located in Australia, using Australian parts and labour.
AS | NZS 1546.1 Certification

Continuing in our commitment to excellence, Halgan Pty Ltd has become the first pre treatment manufacturer in Australia to achieve AS-NZS 1546.1 Certification for the MGT S Series grease traps and pre-treatment vessels.
Environmentally Friendly
Green Star is an internationally recognised sustainability rating system. Halgan’s polyethylene waste water treatment products contribute towards Green Star’s goal of environmental efficiency.
Halgan Pty Ltd is an Australian owned company established in 1996, specialising in all aspects of waste water treatment. We strive to provide the best in environmental
waste water treatment devices

From the initial manufacturing of treatment products with a state-of-the-art rotomoulding machine, right through to the consultation and sales process, after sales servicing and pump outs, Halgan provides a superior product with stringent quality assurance.
We value safety above all else when it comes to
waste water treatment products

and are always looking for ways to improve our work safely and effectively. We promote innovation and teamwork, and always welcome opportunities to deliver excellent services. Halgan is committed to continuing to deliver high-quality
trade waste products
to every client we encounter.

Halgan’s head office and manufacturing plant is based in Sydney, with another office in Queensland. We’re a proud member of the Australian Water Association and Association of Rotational Moulders Australasia, and we also work in conjunction with Standards Australia WaterMark certification, have appraisals compiled by Water Services Association of Australia (WSAA), and boast certification from Green Star, an internationally recognised leader in environmentally sound practises.
We provide our
waste water treatment devices

to many plumbers, developers, engineers and merchants across the country. Our major clients include McDonalds, KFC, Westfield Shopping Centres, Domino’s Pizza, Hogs Breath Café, Gold Coast Hospital, Captain Cook Cruises and Hyatt Resorts.
See all the latest news and updates about trade shows, product launches and more.

There are particular materials that can’t simply be poured down the drain when in liquid form. Fluids such as fats, oils, grease and certain types of waste water need to be disposed of in a specific way, as these materials solidify when they cool down in the pipes, causing blockages that can be expensive to repair. The servicing and disposal of liquid waste must be taken care of properly to ensure all materials are secure and won’t lead to any health or environmental hazards. If you need the expertise of liquid waste servicing specialists to organise removal of your waste, get in touch with the specialists at Halgan.

When it comes to safe and secure liquid waste servicing, you want the very best in the business to get the job done. It’s precisely why Halgan should be your first and only point of contact for sustainable environmental treatment solutions.

Not only do we offer a variety of tanks and containers for liquid waste amongst our range of products, but we also provide liquid waste servicing solutions that remove the waste from your premises in a cost-effective and environmentally friendly manner. We can also clean out and service:

We comply with all environmental regulations regarding the safe collection and disposal of liquid waste to ensure no harm occurs towards people or the planet. To find out more about our liquid waste servicing solutions, call us on 1800 626 753 or submit the enquiry form below.

They say that of the world’s entire water supply, only 3% is deemed to be suitable for human consumption. And of that 3%, 2% is found in ice caps and glaciers. It leaves very little in the way of consumable water that can be used for a wide variety of processes, and leaves us with a need to look towards alternative options to create water that can be used for multiple purposes. This is where the process of water treatment can come in handy.

Water treatment involves the removal of any dangerous contaminants that otherwise prevent water from being safely consumed. Once treated, the water then can be used for a wide variety of purposes including the irrigation of farmland, parks and outdoor sports grounds, and even at car wash facilities. If you’re looking for effective water treatment equipment to reduce the amount of waste water that goes into sewerage, discover the products and expertise of Halgan.
The process of water treatment offers a wide variety of health and environmental benefits no matter how much or how little water is treated. The benefits include:

When you run a commercial or industrial business, you create waste water from the water you use on a daily basis. This is called trade waste, and it can include everything from water used to wash the dishes in the staff lunch room to the water used in the preparation of food. The types of businesses that typically create trade waste include restaurants and cafés, nursing homes and hospitals, car wash facilities, and construction sites. Many of these businesses might be required to have their trade waste treated before it enters the sewage system as part of an agreement with their water supplier. This might include the removal of specific chemicals that may have made their way into the water, or the separation of fats or oils that can affect the waste water’s pH levels. When you need specialist trade waste cleaning at your business, contact the professionals at Halgan for expert service and advice.

For 25 years, the team at Halgan has provided a quality range of waste water treatment products, including those essential for trade waste cleaning services in Sydney and throughout New South Wales. We ensure everything we offer meets strict environmental and occupational health and safety standards, so not only you and your colleagues can rest easy, but so can the planet. We look for innovative, sustainable ways to reduce the amount of waste water that goes into the sewer system, with treatment options that enable the water to be used for other purposes.
If you’d like any more information on how we can assist you with your trade waste cleaning needs, call us on 1800 626 753 or submit the enquiry form below.

The treatment and disposal of household waste water is carried out by one of two ways; either through the public sewer system or with the aid of a septic tank installed underground on your premises. Waste water typically comes in two forms:

Other forms of waste water include dishwasher and water from the kitchen tap; both of which would typically be classed as blackwater due to the potential presence of oils and greases that need to be kept separate from grey water. If you’re looking for a user-friendly, sustainable septic treatment system for your property, check out the options available from Halgan.

When it comes to septic treatment solutions for your property, you can count on the Halgan name to truly deliver. We offer a variety of septic tanks designed to accommodate different sized properties. Our septic treatment options offer numerous features, including:

Even when buried underground, our rotomoulded one piece septic treatment tanks will not corrode, creak or rust, ensuring they’ll keep working at their best. Plus with our generous warranty, you can take comfort in knowing that you’ll enjoy effective septic treatment for years to come. Whether you need to replace an old septic tank or install a new system on a property that isn’t connected to the public sewer system, call Halgan on 1800 626 753 or email info@halgan.com.au to see how we can help you.

Our Association:
All
stormwater pits
and gully traps should be fitted with a lid or grate to prevent any injuries from passersby falling in, as well as keep leaves and other such pollution out of the pit.

A stormwater pit full of leaves becomes useless. The leaves can block the pipe so water can’t pass through, leading it to become a breeding ground for insects and other such pests. Even worse, items such as cigarette butts or litter can go through the stormwater pit, down the pipe, and potentially end up harming the environment.
Fortunately, Halgan
heel guard grate pits
can be used to solve these problems.

Heel guard grate pits keep all debris out thanks to an effective design. The narrowness of the holes in the grate allows water to travel through easily while preventing pollution and waste from falling in. Not only is this form of grate effective and safe, but even women in high heeled shoes can walk across them with confidence knowing that they won’t fall through the gaps.

These grate pits can be used anywhere a stormwater pit is in use. They are ideal for high traffic areas where the heel guard feature is a necessity for pedestrians. Public areas such as parks and petrol stations can also be fitted out with this style of grate. Halgan also recommends
heel guard grate pits
in less populated areas such as construction zones and car parks in order to prevent lost keys and stuck fingers.
To learn more about our available solutions, contact us today.
Grease interceptor traps

are designed to prevent oils, fats and greases from entering the sewerage system. Without an effective trap, fats and oils can cause blockages in your pipes as well as pollute the environment – and clearing blockages from your pipes is not an easy job. Fortunately, Halgan grease interceptor pits can provide effective protection for your pipes and save you money in the long run.
Larger than a regular
grease trap
, our
grease interceptor pits

and traps work by separating food solids, water, oils and grease. The grease-free water then drains into the normal septic system for safe disposal, while the food solids, grease and oil are collected and pumped out at a later time by grease disposal trucks.
With a variety of different models, sizes and brands of
grease interceptors in Australia

, selecting the correct one can be a challenging task. As you can imagine, problems with grease interceptors are messy and costly to deal with. You can count on the Halgan grease interceptor to provide reliable and effective separation of your grease from the sewerage system. These are Australian-made products that you can trust to last for a lifetime.
If you have any questions about our
grease interceptors
in Australia, please contact us today. We can give you detailed information about our products and help you select the right product to meet your individual needs.

The SCD 500 is used in residential septic systems, aerated treatment systems and sand filter systems. Larger models are available for commercial applications

The SCD is designed to be used in the wastewater industry to remove water- borne waste from trade, manufacturing and domestic sewage. Pollutants in the influent flow will consist of oil, grease and suspended matter. The SCD can be retrofitted to existing pre-treatment vessel or installed with new pre-treatment vessels to enhance their performance. The SCD will increase the performance of the pre-treatment vessel by up to 95% .

Pump station systems

are a method of transporting fluids from one place to another. They are needed in many different places for a variety of uses, including kitchens to transport sink water and caravan parks to transport sewage. They are essential for all applications where gravity is not enough to carry water waste to the sewer, helping to prevent a build up of odorous waste and promote sanitary waste removal. Halgan can supply you with pump stations that are tailored to your needs – speak to us today to find out how we can help you.
Under sink pump stations
are designed to carry dirty sink or dishwasher water out of sinks and away. They should be used in conjunction with
grease traps
to minimise the environmental impact of waste water. Halgan kitchen pump stations are designed to fit under the sink, making access for maintenance easier while also reducing installation costs.
All Halgan
pump station systems

are designed to last. They are made from stainless steel or polyethylene, making them durable and acid resistant as well as lightweight and compact. With their ability to be installed either above ground or below, these systems are perfect for relocating. Places such as construction sites, caravan parks and festival locations are ever changing, making it important to be able to transport the necessary equipment that allows for sanitary practices.
Halgan
pump stations
are complete packaged units, meaning no extras need to be purchased and your system will be ready to go the day you install it. Talk to an expert at Halgan today to find out more.

Ideal for a range of commercial premises,
grease traps
prevent oils and solids from entering the
wastewater treatment device

. When grease gets into these devices, it can cause blockages and overflow the wastewater system, resulting in untreated water being released and causing damage to the property as well as the environment.
Halgan grease traps

are a smaller alternative to grease interceptors, making them perfect for sinks, hand basins and dishwashers. However, as they’re modular grease traps, they’re designed to be upgradeable and accept extra modules and expansions.
Halgan provides
custom grease traps
to help any business find the perfect solution, whether you’re undergoing expansion, undertaking a renovation or starting from scratch. There is a wide range of
grease trap sizes

on the market, and Halgan is prepared to find the right one for you. Consider what size will suit your needs best, as a trap that is too large will waste space and may be an unnecessary cost to your business.

We offer small grease traps that can be installed simply and without too much cost to you, as no advanced lifting equipment is required. Alternatively, we can supply large grease traps that are perfect for large restaurants or butchers with a huge output of grease and oil.

Halgan grease traps meet all relevant certification requirements, including Green Star, Standards Australia WaterMark Certification, and Water Services Association of Australia (WSAA). On top of this, we have become the first pre treatment manufacturer in Australia to achieve AS-NZS 1546.1 Certification for some of our modular grease traps.
Browse through our range to find the perfect fit, or contact us for more information or advice, including details about
grease trap pricing in Australia

Storm water pits are a necessity in areas that are prone to flooding, helping to direct rainwater towards a stormwater pipe or other drainage system. Halgan’s
plastic storm water pits
are ideal for construction sites and other locations where a build up of storm water could be problematic.

Without a storm water pit, the drainage pipes designed to carry storm water cannot keep up with the rate of water and overflow, causing damage to property around the pipe and potentially creating a breeding ground for certain bugs.
This makes them essential for:
Halgan
storm water pits
are lightweight and durable, designed for easy lifting and installation, and are easy to transport should the need to move them arise.
Manufactured from UV stabilised polyethylene, they are chemical and impact resistant. This means our
plastic storm water pits

will not crack, corrode or rust. Our products are tested by a qualified structural engineer, so you can be sure they’ll last, but it is important to keep blockages out of storm water pits, as the pipes leading away from them are not equipped to handle leaves and other such debris.
Halgan also has grates and frames for pits available. To learn more, contact our team today.

Halgan™ has  certified according to AS1546.2008 showing our ongoing commitment to the quality and performance of our products, in fact the MGTS™ are the only grease trap certified to Australian Standards

Without certification the consumer is not protected from product that maybe approved by Water Authorities but has been supplied incorrectly to that area, ie, change of wall thickness, no compliance plates and/or change of design/suppliers. These issues are often not picked up until after installation and the customer has little recourse.
Simply put, certification adds confidence to purchasers, regulators and the community.

Every unit we dispatch has installation instructions attached as this is the most important information we can provide for a quick and easy install. Ensuring your site is properly prepared is one of the issues we often find lacking. If a site is not properly excavated, or is an above ground unit is not placed on a flat surface, then the install can become a real problem afterwards.

We recently had a plumber install a MGTR10000 incorrectly on a sloping slab, this put uneven pressure on one side of the unit. The plumber would not accept this was the problem but as with every product, correct installation is key.
If you have any issues or questions regarding you install, please call us on 1800 626 753 or email sales@halgan.com.au

Halgan™ has  certified according to AS1546.2008 showing our ongoing commitment to the quality and performance of our products, in fact the MGTS™ are the only grease trap certified to Australian Standards

Without certification the consumer is not protected from product that maybe approved by Water Authorities but has been supplied incorrectly to that area, ie, change of wall thickness, no compliance plates and/or change of design/suppliers. These issues are often not picked up until after installation and the customer has little recourse.
Simply put, certification adds confidence to purchasers, regulators and the community.

In November last year the Senate passed the Government’s legislation to re-establish the Australian Building and Construction Commission (ABCC) –  this was the bill used in July as a constitutional trigger for the double dissolution election, so it’s been controversial from the start.
It’s aim is to police illegal activity within the construction industry and improve productivity through tougher penalties, but the Opposition and Greens say it is “anti-union”.

However what interests us most is  the new building codes for Commonwealth-funded building projects which will require locally made building materials and content have been inserted into procurement standards.
Taking effect from March this year businesses bidding for these projects worth more than $4 million must show
It’s important to Australian manufacturers that the new building code will be backing locally made product that’s fit for purpose and adheres to Australian Standards.
With Water Authorities throughout Australia still varying in what they approve, the new code is welcomed by  Halgan
, an Australian made and owned Company that manufactures the only Certified AS/NZ1546.1 grease trap on the market .

We are pleased to announce the appointment of Tony Onsley as Halgan’s new Chief Executive Officer (CEO).

Tony brings decades of experience to the position and has a proven record of taking companies like Halgan to the next level. This aligns with our plans for major expansion in the Australian market. Previously, Tony was Chief Executive Officer of MVS National and has held executive roles with S.C. Johnson, Lion Nathan, GEON, Sirius Corporation and Moore Business Systems Australia.

This is an enormous opportunity for Halgan, and all of our staff, to grow and build upon our successes to date.  As CEO, Tony will steer Halgan into the future, and build on the leadership position of the company, with an exciting new vision for expansion, both nationally and internationally.

Tony’s appointment as CEO is a clear reflection of the company’s current state; optimistic, motivated and enthusiastic after another strong year of growth and success.  With Tony as CEO we all look forward to this exciting new phase in Halgan’s expansion and on-going success.

We’re excited to announce we’ve opened up Halgan Liquid Waste, a division that will concentrate exclusively on grease trap and liquid waste servicing.  Halgan Liquid Waste currently covers from South East Queensland, New South Wales through to Melbourne and Geelong in Victoria.

Our service includes cleaning, collecting and disposing of liquid trade waste on a contract basis or by emergency call out and includes the complete pump out and removal of all FOG’s (fat, oil, grease), washing and scraping of walls, lids and SCD / baffles. All waste is moved with EPA Licensed Transporters to an EPA Licensed facility where it is treated in accordance with local authorities, and used for beneficial reuse where possible.
We all log all servicing with the appropriate water authority and report trap condition and issues/problems to our customers.
For customer quotes and information please call us on 1800 626 753 or email info@halganliquidwaste.com.au
